Package core

Class Quaternion

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Imaginary
      • core.Quaternion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IImaginary, IUtils, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Quaternion>, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Float>
    public class Quaternion
extends Imaginary
implements java.lang.Comparable<Quaternion>
    A four-dimensional imaginary number. The w component is the real number; the x, y and z components are coefficients of the imaginary i, j and k. Discovered by William R. Hamilton in the formula i2 = j2 = k2 = ijk = -1.0 . Quaternions with a magnitude of 1.0 are commonly used to rotate 3D objects from one orientation to another.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Quaternion.AbstrComparator
      An abstract class that may serve as an umbrella for any custom comparators of Quaternions.
      static class  Quaternion.AbstrEasing
      An abstract class to facilitate the creation of quaternion easing functions.
      static class  Quaternion.ComparatorRealImag
      Compares two quaternions based on the real component and on a vector comparison for the imaginary component.
      static class  Quaternion.IteratorWFirst
      An iterator, which allows a quaternion's components to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.
      static class  Quaternion.IteratorWLast
      An iterator, which allows a quaternion's components to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.
      static class  Quaternion.QIterator
      An iterator, which allows a quaternion's components to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.
      static class  Quaternion.Slerp
      A functional class to ease between two quaternions by spherical interpolation (slerp).

      static float dot​(Quaternion a, Quaternion b)
      Finds the dot product of two quaternions by summing the products of their corresponding components.

      a · b := areal breal + aimag · bimag

      The dot product of a quaternion with itself is equal to its magnitude squared.

      • dot

        public static float dot​(Quaternion a,
                        Quaternion b)
        Finds the dot product of two quaternions by summing the products of their corresponding components.

        a · b := areal breal + aimag · bimag

        The dot product of a quaternion with itself is equal to its magnitude squared.
        Parameters:
        a - left operand
        b - right operand
        Returns:
        the dot product
        See Also:
        Vec3.dot(Vec3, Vec3)

        target - the output quaternion

        the random quaternion

      • clone

        public Quaternion clone()
        Returns a new quaternion with this quaternion's components. Java's cloneable interface is problematic; use set or a copy constructor instead.
        Returns:
        a new quaternion
        See Also:
        set(Quaternion), Quaternion(Quaternion)

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Quaternion quat)
        Returns -1 when this quaternion is less than the comparisand; 1 when it is greater than; 0 when the two are 'equal'. The implementation of this method allows collections of quaternions to be sorted. This depends upon the static comparator of the Quaternion class, which can be changed.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Quaternion>
        Parameters:
        quat - the comparisand
        Returns:
        the numeric code
        See Also:
        COMPARATOR
